definition[0]: to try to get help, advice, or sympathy from someone
example[0]: I donâ€™t know who to turn to.
example[1]: The Namibian government turned to South Africa for help.
definition[1]: to start to do or use something new, especially as a way of solving a problem
example[2]: Many people here are turning to solar power.
example[3]: addicts who turn to crime to finance their habit
definition[2]: to become a different quality, attitude, form of a substance etc, or to make something do this
example[4]: Our laughter turned to horror as we realized that Jody was really hurt.
example[5]: When water turns to steam, it expands.
example[6]: A sudden storm turned the earth to mud.
definition[3]: to look at a particular page in a book
example[7]: Turn to page 655 for more information.
